A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The actors do what they can with Johnson's confused script and even more confused direction\, but the film falls short-far\, far short-of Abrams's The Force Awakens\, which understood the formula of the Star Wars universe and seamlessly integrated new characters with old favourites for a rollicking good time. By contrast\, The Last Jedi is overlong\, needlessly complicated\, and ultimately\, pointless. Too bad they didn't go with Kasdan's script-he clearly has a better understanding of the source material.
